alert.note: Alert for Craig; Mayes; Nowata; Rogers (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Craig, northeastern Rogers, Mayes and southeastern Nowata Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 330 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles north of White Oak to near Chelsea to 3 miles west of Salina to 8 miles northeast of Wagoner. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Vinita... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Chouteau... Chelsea... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Adair... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Disney... Big Cabin... Pensacola... New Alluwe... Hoot Owl... Cherokee State Park... White Oak... Spavinaw State Park... Sportsmen Acres Community... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 258 and 289. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
